critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of an agreement within the construction industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It emphasizes compliance with the Act and the Code of Fair Competition, indicating a strong role for the federal government in regulating industry and labor relations. The agreement aims to establish fair competition and standards within the plumbing contracting sector in specific regions of Indiana. The document also grants the National Industrial Recovery Board the authority to provide exceptions and exemptions to avoid undue hardship, suggesting a degree of flexibility within the regulatory framework.
